intro: Lophostachys, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae, native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. The plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their compound leaves and yellow or white flowers. They have adapted to harsh environments through deep root systems and water-storing tissues. Lophostachys species are often used in landscaping due to their drought tolerance and ornamental value.
